column5: This morning was the start of the Salmon derby so i headed out at 5am the launch was busy by the time i got there and i only live 5 minuets away the morning started out slow marked a lot of fish then around 9am got my first fish which i lost at the side of the boat number 2 went the same way then came number 3 got him on the down rigger in 125fow and 80 feet down this one i got in the boat so off i went to the weigh station  weighed in at 23.28  i will be back out again tonight  Rob
That's one big, beautiful feesh.  Thanks!
WTG Rob how bout some shots of the new boat

Bro thats awesome,nice one to enter. Any idea where that one stood in the standings today? Go get,em. You seem to have picked this down rigg,n thing up pretty quick. Congrats on the 23 pounder.  You need to get a partner down there with you so you dont have to do it yourself. Wheres Sinker? Sinker,where are ya?  BTW,Just keep the cut bait away from him,he probly salt and dry it, then make fish cakes with it.LOL

GOOD FISH!  I've been out four times in the past 5 days and hooked at least 7 fish every time.  This morning I was out off of Bowmanville, and went 7 for 9 with 4 rainbows and 3 chinook.  The biggest chinook was about 13 and the biggest bow was about 9.  The biggest chinook I've landed thus far has been 26, but a few more twenty plus fish have been boated as well.  Lake O has been very good to me recently!
He had a date with a musky lol
Hey bro didn't even make the top ten so far first is 31.14 tenth place is 25.8 maybe next week  Rob
Sounds good for the first day. Congrats on the 23 lber.
Nice Salmon. I'm sure the big ones will start showing up soon enough! Good luck!
If I didn't already have plans made, I'd of been there for sure!! Next weekend.....can't wait!!  Thats a beauty fish!!!  Sinker
